deployment.name: Public Transportation Department
deployment.description: Our mission is to improve public transportation through citizen submitted data.

surveys.name: Street maintenance
surveys.description: Reports about streets that need resurfacing, repairs, or the removal of a hazard.

surveys.name: Creeks/drainage problems
surveys.description: Reports about obstructions to flowing water, or overflowing water.

surveys.name: Property damage
surveys.description: Reports of vandalism, including graffiti, perpetrated by another person.

surveys.name: Parking
surveys.description: Reports about parkng meters and signs that are malfunctioning or damaged.

posts.title: Uneven pavement on North Lamar Blvd
posts.description: Cracks in the road at N. Lamar Blvd. near 45th Street are causing vehicles to absorb the shock of hitting a four-inch difference in height in the pavement.

posts.title: Permanent marker and cracks in Slake Cafe window
posts.description:
Someone wrote in permanent marker on the street-facing windows to Slake Cafe. There also appears to be two new cracks in the same window, caused by blunt impact.

This is the third time this year that graffiti has been drawn on the cafe's 7th Street storefront. We'd appreciate any help removing the graffiti or deterring the vandalism.

posts.title: Blocked storm drain in front of Bartholomew District Park
posts.description: The storm drain on Berkman Drive that allows water to flow into the creek inside Bartholomew District Park is clogged with branches and construction materials. The last few rain storms have created a three-inches-deep backup of water on the roadway at this site.

posts.title: Obstructed view of street lights at South Congress Ave. and Live Oak St.
posts.description:
The oak trees at the intersection of S. Congress Ave. and Live Oak St. have grown such that northbound traffic often can't see the street lights until they're 15 yards away -- far too late to adjust their speed.

These trees need to be trimmed so northbound traffic can see the street light from further away.

posts.title: Disabled vehicle parked at Comal Pocket Park for four months
posts.description:
An abandoned green Mitsubishi SUV has been parked on Comal and 3rd Street, in front of the Comal Pocket Park, for four months. Its front two tires are now flat.

Please tow this vehicle away.
